Class Timer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.Timer
public class Timer extends Object
Manages a countdown timer for timed game modes.

The Timer class provides functionality for setting, starting, pausing, resetting, and stopping a countdown timer. It can also display the remaining time in a JavaFX Label and updates the UI in a thread-safe manner using Platform.runLater(java.lang.Runnable).

This class is responsible for:

  • Setting the timer duration
  • Starting the timer
  • Pausing and resuming the timer
  • Resetting the timer
  • Stopping the timer

All fields and methods are static, as only one global timer is active at any given time.

    • Timer

      public Timer()

  • Method Details

    • setTimer

      public static void setTimer(int minutes)
      Sets the timer duration in minutes.
      Parameters:
      minutes - the countdown duration in minutes

    • setLabel

      public static void setLabel(javafx.scene.control.Label label, javafx.scene.layout.VBox vBox)
      Assigns a JavaFX label to display the remaining time.

      If the timer is set to 0 minutes, the VBox will be hidden.

      Parameters:
      label - the label to update with remaining time
      vBox - the container holding the label

    • start

      public static void start()
      Starts the countdown timer in a background thread.

      The timer decrements every second and updates the assigned display label.

    • pause

      public static void pause(boolean isPause)
      Pauses or resumes the timer.
      Parameters:
      isPause - true to pause the timer, false to resume

    • reset

      public static void reset()
      Resets the timer to its original duration.

      If the timer duration is zero, this method does nothing.

    • stop

      public static void stop()
      Stops the timer and clears the assigned display label.

    • getStartingTime

      public static int getStartingTime()
      Returns the total duration of the timer in seconds.

      Used in Score to determine the correct save line

      Returns:
      the total timer duration in seconds

    • getRemainingSeconds

      public static int getRemainingSeconds()
      Returns the remaining seconds left in the countdown.

      Primarily used for testing

      Returns:
      the remaining seconds
